Dungeon Layout

The Remixed Dungeon has a complex layout with multiple interconnected levels and special areas. The dungeon structure is defined by a graph in the Dungeon.json file.

Main Dungeon Progression

The main dungeon progression follows this order:

  • Town (Level town_2) - Starting area with shops and services (depth 0)
  • Sewers (Levels 1-4) - Early game area with basic enemies (depth 1-4)
  • Sewer Boss Level (Level 5) - Features the Goo boss (depth 5) - see Goo
  • Portal Room (Level portal_room_lvl5) - Transitional area connecting to special levels
  • Prison (Levels 6-9) - Mid-game area, features Tengu boss (depth 6-9)
  • Prison Boss Level (Level 10) - Features the Tengu boss (depth 10) - see Tengu
  • Portal Room (Level portal_room_lvl10) - Transitional area
  • Caves (Levels 11-14) - Underground caves, features DM-300 boss (depth 11-14)
  • Caves Boss Level (Level 15) - Features the DM-300 boss (depth 15) - see DM300
  • Portal Room (Level portal_room_lvl15) - Transitional area
  • City (Levels 16-19) - Dwarven metropolis, features Dwarven King boss (depth 16-19)
  • City Boss Level (Level 20) - Features the King boss (depth 20) - see King
  • Portal Room (Level portal_room_lvl20) - Transitional area
  • Last Shop Level (Level 21) - Final shop before demon halls (depth 21) - see Shops
  • Halls (Levels 22-24) - Demon halls, features Yog-Dzewa's guardians (depth 22-24)
  • Shadow Lord Level (Level 25) - Features Shadow Lord boss (depth 25) - see Shadow Lord
  • Portal Room (Level portal_room_lvl25) - Transitional area
  • Fake Last Level (Level 26) - Guts level entrance (depth 26) - see Guts
  • Guts (Levels 27-30) - Additional challenging areas (depth 27-30)
  • Halls Boss Level (Level 31) - Features the final Yog-Dzewa boss (depth 31) - see Yog-Dzewa
  • Portal Room (Level portal_room_lvl31) - Transitional area to final level
  • Last Level (Level 32) - True final level (depth 32) - see Yog-Dzewa

Special Areas

The dungeon also contains special side areas that branch from the main progression:

  • Spider Nests (Levels 6s-10s) - Spider-themed areas branching from Level 5 (depth 6-10)
  • Necropolis (Levels necro1-necro5) - Undead-themed area branching from Level 7 (depth 8-12)
  • Ice Caves (Levels ice1-ice5) - Cold-themed area branching from Level 14 (depth 15-19)
  • Sub Levels - Various special themed areas

Town Features

The Town area (Level town_2) contains several special buildings:

  • Church (Level church_2) - Healing and blessings
  • Cinema (Level cinema_2) - Special area
  • Inn (Level inn_2) - Rest and recovery
  • Library (Level library_2) - Knowledge and information
  • Fortune Teller (Level fortune_2) - Special services
  • Shop (Level shop_town_2) - Equipment and supplies

Dungeon Structure Details

  • Graph-Based Navigation: Dungeon connections are defined in a graph structure in Dungeon.json
  • Depth Values: Each level has a depth value that determines item generation and mob stats
  • Portal Rooms: Special transitional levels connect main dungeon sections
  • Branching Areas: Special levels like Spider Nests, Necropolis, and Ice Caves branch from main progression
  • Safe Levels: Town levels and some special buildings are marked as safe (no monsters)
  • Music Themes: Each area has distinct background music
  • Size Variations: Levels have different dimensions, from 16×16 (Spider levels) to 64×64 (Spider Boss)

Level Connections

The dungeon graph allows for non-linear exploration in some areas:

  • Spider Nest levels form a loop: 6s→7s→8s→9s→10s→6s
  • Necropolis levels form a loop: necro1→necro2→necro3→necro4→necro5→necro1
  • Ice Caves form a loop: ice1→ice2→ice3→ice4→ice5→ice1
  • Each level connects to the next in the main progression
  • Town connects to multiple buildings and Level 1 (Sewer)

Content Verification

  • Information Source: Java class DungeonGenerator.java and Dungeon.json
  • Structure Verification: Properties extracted from the actual dungeon graph in Dungeon.json
  • Level Details: Based on code analysis of level definitions and connections
  • Last Updated: Verified against source code
